full_summary:
# Conodont Snorkel Arm Ventilation and Suppression System Tender

**Title**
English Title: Conodont Snorkel Arm Ventilation and Suppression System
French Title: Système de ventilation du bras du tuba et de suppression pour Conodont

**Reference Number**
: cb-798-23910631

**Solicitation Number**
: NRCan-5000074660

**Publication Date**
: January 18, 2024

**Tender Closing Date**
: February 2, 2024, 4:00 PM EST

**Contract Type**
: Professional Services Contract

**Classification**
: 32151800-Safety control devices, 81100000-Professional engineering services, 81101500-Civil engineering, 81101505-Structural engineering, 81101508-Architectural engineering, 81101515-Plant or facility infrastructure engineering, 81141802-Industrial hygiene or ventilation

**Procurement Category**
: Services

**Notice Type**
: Request for Proposal

**Procurement Method**
: Competitive traditional process

**Selection Criteria**
: Lowest price

**Tender Description**

The Government of Canada, through Natural Resources Canada, solicits responses from qualified contractors for the provision of engineering drawings for the Conodont Snorkel Arm Ventilation and Suppression System. This project requires the services of a Professional Engineer (Senior Level) to produce detailed engineering designs in accordance with relevant regulatory requirements.

The procurement method is a ProServices Supply Arrangement (SA) under which bids are encouraged for work below the CKFTA (Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement) threshold. The government reserves the right to award the contract based on the lowest bids received.

**Address**
: 580 Booth Street, Ottawa, ON K1A 0E4

**Contact Information**
: Jinping Wei
jinping.wei@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca
(343) 541-7931
Canada

**Attachments**
: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/29794/npp-nrcan-5000074660.pdf

 
In your copy, format properly, and correct grammar and sentence structure.  Include relevant information but keep your response concise. Use bullet points if necessary.  Be professional and direct.  Use proper punctuation and capitalization.  

Answers to questions based on the tender requirements are included below.  If the questions came from the original submission, I deleted redundant information or reph
